items.sentence: If you don't know the meaning of a word, look it up in a dictionary.
I haven't seen you for a long time. Come and see me once in a while.
He bought a new car. He had had his old one for more than ten years.
We did our best to help him, but he didn't so much as say thank you.
If there's anything I can do for you, don't hesitate to let me know.
I have three sons. One is in New York, but the others are in London.
Tom will be here soon, but maybe not as soon as we'd like him to be.
I'm grateful to my parents for doing everything they've done for me.
It isn't until you have lost your health that you realize its value.
It's not until you have lost your health that you realize its value.
